DataElement.preferredName: Breast Conservation Treatment Post Neoadjuvant Therapy Refuse
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the reason a patient refused breast conservation treatment, surgical excision limited to the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue followed by radiation therapy, following neoadjuvant therapy, treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Breast Conservation Treatment Post Neoadjuvant Therapy Refuse
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the patient's refusal of breast conservation treatment, surgical excision limited to the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue followed by radiation therapy, following neoadjuvant therapy, treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Breast conservation treatment is defined as excision of the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue, followed by radiation therapy.  This procedure is also referred to as lumpectomy, segmental mastectomy, or partial mastectomy. (from Consensus Statements: Treatment of Early-stage Breast Cancer, 1990)

Concepts.definition: Breast conservation treatment is defined as excision of the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue, followed by radiation therapy.  This procedure is also referred to as lumpectomy, segmental mastectomy, or partial mastectomy. (from Consensus Statements: Treatment of Early-stage Breast Cancer, 1990)

Property.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:Treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents. Induction therapy is followed by additional therapy to eliminate whatever cancer remains.:To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
Therapy administered prior to the primary treatment for the purpose of making the primary treatment more effective.
To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An explanation why Breast Conservation Treatment was refused.

PermissibleValues.value: Avoid possible return trip to the operating room

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Avoid possible return trip to the operating room
